medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric abdominal pain, bloating, and nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began last evening with abdominal bloating in the afternoon. After dinner around 6pm, epigastric pain started and progressively worsened, eventually localizing to the RLQ. The pain was associated with nausea but no vomiting. No changes in bowel habits or diarrhea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic palpitations & SVT (previously offered ablation but declined), breast cancer, chronic constipation, uterine prolapse, borderline (diet controlled) diabetes, last colonoscopy was normal, past surgical history includes right mastectomy, hysterectomy, tonsillectomy, and ovarian cysts.
medical_history.family_history: Both her children have Wolfram's syndrome and AVNRT.
